result.execSummary:
The defendant Anaira Marrero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil judgment entered against defendant for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

miscConds.notes: Restitution must be paid during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after are. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. No contact with Georgetown Market or its employees. No contact, directly or indirectly, with co-actors. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law, within 30 days of today's date, and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Anaira Marrero in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Anaira Marrero in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
  Interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez. Interpreter has been previously sworn. Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. The State, however, indicates that the front page of the PSI says DNA is not required but upon reading the PSI, believes DNA is mandatory. The Court notes that there has been more than one denial in the PSI. Ms. Johnson has discussed same with the defendant and notes that her position is best stated in the letter provided to the Court which indicates that the defendant understands her options and wishes to go forward today.

BTC: sent w/held - 3 yrs prob

Defendant Anaira Marrero in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Anaira Marrero in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.

Ct 1: 943.32(2) Armed Robbery. No contact with the co-defendants, JA and KMS .  No contact with victim store, Georgetown Market, except for restitution purposes. No contact with the victims, MKR and CH (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with co-defendants. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  Make all court appearances on time.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor/house arrest through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defense is asking $1000.00 cash and $10,000.00 to be co-signed with mother. The State does not object to a reduction in bond but the State asks for $5,000.00 cash with all other condtions suggested by defense counsel.

BTC: Modify bond to $5,000.00 cash. GPS/house arrest. No contact with co-defts. All other previously ordered conditions remain
